body:
Seems like its a driver issue. Booted into Windows where it works just fine
```ignore
AdapterInfo { name: "ANGLE (NVIDIA, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2070 SUPER (0x00001E84) Direct3D11 vs_5_0 ps_5_0, D3D11)", vendor: 4318, device: 0, device_type: Other, driver: "WebGL 2.0 (OpenGL ES", driver_info: "3.0 Chromium)", backend: Gl }
```
Does https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/15163 help at all with this?

> Does #15163 help at all with this?

Not at all unfortunately, but it seems to be even more broken now on bevy main.

### Your branch 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/58764b95-f302-45dd-8d17-c394234b3d35)

### Bevy main (8bfe635)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/12879a16-99dd-4dbb-99b1-b56ad48cd648)
Also tried it with the commit I used originally in the issue and it looks like it did before. Im going to try to bisect it to see what commit made it worse
[a0f5ea0](https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/commit/a0f5ea0d3621a14bdc06d1e3bf1a8d9de90d409b) is the commit that broke it further. (Still only on wasm)

Yeah that makes sense, that commit changed outlines to use the shader to draw the outlines with border radius too.

I could add a mode to the shader which would instruct it to ignore border radius and always draw square borders. It's not ideal but at least apps would be usable again.
Yeah, that useable apps are preferable :sweat_smile:  Let me know if you need me to do any more testing

This is still an issue, below is a screenshot from the Borders example on the bevy website.

Ive now also seen it on a colleagues computer, he also has an Nvidia GPU and is on Linux so the problem seems to be specifically with WASM on Linux machines with an Nvidia GPU.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/70bfbce7-f64e-4320-9850-491fb282860f)
I'm having the same issue. I'm seeing the same screen as the image above, running on a Linux machine with an Nvidia GPU, only in Wasm.

issue.title: Strange wasm render error on my linux desktop browser

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
## Bevy version
bevy 0.15

## \[Optional\] Relevant system information

If you cannot get Bevy to build or run on your machine, please include:

- the Rust version you're using (you can get this by running `cargo --version`)
  -  rust version:   v1.83.0-nightly
  
- the operating system or browser used, including its version
  - Linux6.12.7-arch1-1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Fri, 27 Dec 2024 14:24:37 +0000 x86_64 GNU/Linux
  - chrome  Version 131.0.6778.204 (Official Build) (64-bit)
If your bug is rendering-related, copy the adapter info that appears when you run Bevy.

```ignore
` AdapterInfo { name: "NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 3GB", vendor: 4318, device: 7044, device_type: DiscreteGpu, driver: "NVIDIA", driver_info: "565.77", backend: Vulkan }`
```
browser
```ignore
`AdapterInfo { name: "ANGLE (Google, Vulkan 1.3.0 (SwiftShader Device (Subzero) (0x0000C0DE)), SwiftShader driver)", vendor: 0, device: 0, device_type: Cpu, driver: "", driver_info: "WebGL 2.0 (OpenGL ES 3.0 Chromium)", backend: Gl }`
```

You should also consider testing the examples of our upstream dependencies to help isolate any setup-specific issue:

- [`wgpu`](https://github.com/gfx-rs/wgpu) for rendering problems
- [`winit`](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit) for input and window management
- [`gilrs`](https://docs.rs/gilrs/latest/gilrs/) for gamepad inputs

## What you did

spawn three node under the cell,   one is visible , other are hidden.

## What went wrong

In my linux desktop , chrome and firefox render wasm error,   native is ok
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/678bb4fb-3980-49ef-9638-7d368f2c4112)


## Additional information

Other information that can be used to further reproduce or isolate the problem.
This commonly includes:

[online demo](https://foxzool.github.io/nyt_sudoku/)
[source code](https://github.com/foxzool/nyt_sudoku)

body:
I think it's the anti-aliased version of the sdfs:
https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/blob/1030a99b8e2680a7e696d6433b79f5671768231c/crates/bevy_ui/src/render/ui.wgsl#L166

Without anti-aliasing I got the rounded-borders to work.
Could also be alpha-values related?

issue.title: Fixing ui antialiasing clamp call parameters order (#14970)

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective

Fixes #14970

## Solution

It seems the clamp call in `ui.wgsl` had the parameters order incorrect.

## Testing

Tested using examples/ui in native and my current project in wasm - both in linux.
Could use some help with testing in other platforms.

---
